title: Mourning the death of David A. Hartz, Jr., distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning  the  death  of  David  A. Hartz, Jr.,
distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, David A. Hartz, Jr. of Fulton, Kentucky, formerly of Deposit,
New York, died on Wednesday, August 4, 2010, at the age of 56; and
  WHEREAS, David A. Hartz, Jr. distinguished himself in  his  profession
and  by  his  sincere  dedication  and  substantial  contribution to the
welfare of his community; and
  WHEREAS, In 1997, David A. Hartz, Jr., known as Jim, moved  to  Fulton
from Deposit, New York; he was a former Broome County Emergency Services
Dispatcher and former Chief of the Deposit Fire Department; and
  WHEREAS,  A member of St. Edwards Catholic Church in Fulton, Kentucky,
David A. Hartz, Jr. served as Fire Chief of the Fulton  Fire  Department
and was the Twin Cities Ambulance Service Director; and
  WHEREAS,  Furthermore, David A. Hartz, Jr. was a member of the Knights
of Columbus,  Kentucky  Firefighters  Association,  KAPA,  KCCRB,  JPFA,
KBEMS, and HazMat 1; and
  WHEREAS, David A. Hartz, Jr.'s commitment to excellence, and his spir-
it  of  humanity,  carried over into all fields of enterprise, including
charitable and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, David A. Hartz, Jr. is survived by  his  wife  Deb  (Raymond)
Hartz,  whom  he  married  December  8, 1973; a son and daughter-in-law,
Shawn and Breana Hartz; two daughters and sons-in-law, Summer and Thomas
Reis, and Megan and John Miller; his parents, Joan C. (Wheeler)  Raymond
and  David A. Hartz, Sr.; 10 grandchildren, Gage Hartz, Lana Hartz, Andy
Sipos, Marisa Reis, Thomas Reis, Jr., Tyler  Reis,  Abby  Miller,  Avery
Miller,  Ryan  Shilling and Ty Shilling; a brother, Randy Hartz; and two
sisters, Julie Wist and Angie Smith; and
  WHEREAS, Armed with a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with  a  sense  of
compassion, and comforted by a loving family, David A. Hartz, Jr. leaves
behind  a  legacy  which  will  long endure the passage of time and will
remain as a comforting memory to all  he  served  and  befriended;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
mourn the death of  David  A.  Hartz,  Jr.,  distinguished  citizen  and
devoted member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of David A. Hartz, Jr.
